alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 2:58PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt will continue. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Randlett. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, minor flooding is expected across low-lying agricultural land along the Duchesne River. At 13.3 feet, fields become inundated along the river, southeast of Randlett. Some private bridges and irrigation works may also experience damage from high water and/or debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around bankfull through the weekend, with a maximum of 12.3 feet expected on Saturday. - Action stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
